chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type

Goal:
forall l m : list A, permutation l m -> permutation m l

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive permutation : list A -> list A -> Prop := permutation_nil : permutation [] [] | permutation_skip : forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l2 l1 -> permutation (a :: l2) (a :: l1) | permutation_swap : forall (a b : A) (l : list A), permutation (a :: b :: l) (b :: a :: l) | permutation_trans : forall l1 l2 l3 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> permutation l2 l3 -> permutation l1 l3 Arguments permutation (_ _)%list_scope Arguments permutation_skip _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments permutation_swap _ _ _%list_scope Arguments permutation_trans (_ _ _)%list_scope
permutation_refl : forall l : list A, permutation l l
permutation_sind : forall P : list A -> list A -> SProp, P [] [] -> (forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l2 l1 -> P l2 l1 -> P (a :: l2) (a :: l1)) -> (forall (a b : A) (l : list A), P (a :: b :: l) (b :: a :: l)) -> (forall l1 l2 l3 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> P l1 l2 -> permutation l2 l3 -> P l2 l3 -> P l1 l3) -> forall l l0 : list A, permutation l l0 -> P l l0
permutation_ind : forall P : list A -> list A -> Prop, P [] [] -> (forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l2 l1 -> P l2 l1 -> P (a :: l2) (a :: l1)) -> (forall (a b : A) (l : list A), P (a :: b :: l) (b :: a :: l)) -> (forall l1 l2 l3 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> P l1 l2 -> permutation l2 l3 -> P l2 l3 -> P l1 l3) -> forall l l0 : list A, permutation l l0 -> P l l0
permutation_trans : forall l1 l2 l3 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> permutation l2 l3 -> permutation l1 l3
in_or_app : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), In a l \/ In a m -> In a (l ++ m)
Inductive permutation : list A -> list A -> Prop := permutation_nil : permutation [] [] | permutation_skip : forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l2 l1 -> permutation (a :: l2) (a :: l1) | permutation_swap : forall (a b : A) (l : list A), permutation (a :: b :: l) (b :: a :: l) | permutation_trans : forall l1 l2 l3 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> permutation l2 l3 -> permutation l1 l3 Arguments permutation (_ _)%list_scope Arguments permutation_skip _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments permutation_swap _ _ _%list_scope Arguments permutation_trans (_ _ _)%list_scope
Nat.le_antisymm : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> m <= n -> n = m
incl_appl : forall (A : Type) (l m n : list A), incl l n -> incl l (n ++ m)
incl_appr : forall (A : Type) (l m n : list A), incl l n -> incl l (m ++ n)
Nat.lt_le_incl : forall n m : nat, n < m -> n <= m
gt_S_le : forall n m : nat, S m > n -> n <= m
gt_le_S : forall n m : nat, m > n -> S n <= m
Record SOR (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_SOR_theory { SORsetoid : Setoid.Setoid_Theory R req; SORplus_wd : forall x1 x2 : R, req x1 x2 -> forall y1 y2 : R, req y1 y2 ->...-> rlt rO (rtimes n m); SORneq_0_1 : ~ req rO rI } Arguments OrderedRing.SOR [R]%type_scope _ _ (_ _ _ _ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments OrderedRing.mk_SOR_theory [R]%type_scope [rO rI] [rplus rtimes rminus ropp req]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope _ (_ _ _ _ _)%function_scope _ (_ _ _ _ _ _ _)%function_scope
Nat.le_gt_cases : forall n m : nat, n <= m \/ m < n
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_iff : forall n m : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat n = BinInt.Z.of_nat m < -> n = m
Nat.sub_0_le : forall n m : nat, n - m = 0 < -> n <= m
permutation_skip : forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l2 l1 -> permutation (a :: l2) (a :: l1)
Inductive le (n : nat) : nat -> Prop := le_n : n <= n | le_S : forall m : nat, n <= m -> n <= S m Arguments le (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments le_n _%nat_scope Arguments le_S (_ _)%nat_scope
gt = fun n m : nat => m < n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gt (_ _)%nat_scope
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
BinIntDef.Z.sub = fun m n : BinNums.Z => BinIntDef.Z.add m (BinIntDef.Z.opp n) : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.sub (_ _)%Z_scope
skipn_firstn_comm : forall (A : Type) (m n : nat) (l : list A), skipn m (firstn n l) = firstn (n - m) (skipn m l)
Ring_polynom.mkVmon = fun (i : BinNums.positive) (M : Ring_polynom.Mon) => match M with | Ring_polynom.mon0 => Ring_polynom.vmon i Ring_polynom.mon0 | Ring_polynom.zmon j m => Ring_polynom.vmon i (Ring_polynom.zmon_pred j m) | Ring_polynom.vmon i' m => Ring_polynom.vmon (BinPos.Pos.add i i') m end : BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Mon Arguments Ring_polynom.mkVmon _%positive_scope
BinNatDef.N.add = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => m | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => n | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.add p q) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.add (_ _)%N_scope
